main event: An object was detected on ground radar in Las Vegas, Nevada on July 3, 1957, that abruptly stopped and remained stationary for 2 minutes.
interesting points: The sighting involved high-speed movements with speeds estimated between 1200 - 1800 MPH., The radar operators observed the object making abrupt changes in direction., A power supply issue was noted as a possible explanation for the sighting., The case remains unexplained as no natural cause has been positively identified., Observers reported a brilliant bluish-white light during the previous sightings.
witness description: radar operators Lloyd H. Bond and Joseph Heller
